what: Miettinen-Nurminen Confidence Interval for Difference in Proportions — ci_prop_diff_mn
title: Miettinen-Nurminen Confidence Interval for Difference in Proportions — ci_prop_diff_mn
text: Calculates Miettinen-Nurminen (MN) confidence interval difference two proportions. method can accurate traditional methods, especially small sample sizes proportions close 0 1.

title: Miettinen-Nurminen Confidence Interval for Difference in Proportions — ci_prop_diff_mn
code: ci_prop_diff_mn(x, by, conf.level = 0.95, delta = NULL, data = NULL)

title: Miettinen-Nurminen Confidence Interval for Difference in Proportions — ci_prop_diff_mn
text: x binary vector representing responses. Can also column name data frame provided `data` argument. character factor vector exactly two unique levels identifying two groups compare. Can also column name data frame provided `data` argument. conf.level numeric value 0 1 specifying confidence level. Default 0.95 (95% confidence). delta Optional numeric value(s) hypothesis testing. provided, function returns test statistic p-value `delta` hypothesis. data Optional data frame containing variables specified `x` ``.

title: Miettinen-Nurminen Confidence Interval for Difference in Proportions — ci_prop_diff_mn
text: list containing following components:  estimate point estimate difference proportions (p_x - p_y) conf.low Lower bound confidence interval conf.high Upper bound confidence interval conf.level confidence level used delta delta value used statistic Z-Statistic given `delta` null hypothesis p.value p-value given `delta` null hypothesis method Description method used ("Miettinen-Nurminen Confidence Interval") `delta` provided statistic p.value NULL

title: Miettinen-Nurminen Confidence Interval for Difference in Proportions — ci_prop_diff_mn
text: function implements Miettinen-Nurminen method compute confidence intervals difference two proportions. approach: Calculates Miettinen-Nurminen score test statistic different possible values proportion difference (delta) Identifies delta values test statistic equals critical value corresponding desired confidence level Returns boundary values confidence interval limits method uses score test small-sample correction factor, making accurate normal approximation methods, especially small samples extreme proportions. equation test statistics follows: $$ T_\delta = \frac{\hat{p_x} - \hat{p_y} - \delta}{\sigma_{mn}(\delta)}$$ \(\hat{p_*} = s_*/n_*\) represent observed number successes divided number participant group. \(\sigma_{mn}(\delta)\) function delta values create following equation" \(\tilde{p_*}\) represent MLE proportions. $$ \sigma_{mn}(\delta) = \sqrt{\left[\frac{\tilde{p_y}(1-\tilde{p_y})}{n_x}+\frac{\tilde{p_x}(1-\tilde{p_x})}{n_y} \right]\left(\frac{N}{N-1}\right)} $$ \( \tilde{p_x} = 2p\cdot{cos()} - \frac{L_2}{3L_3}\) \( \tilde{p_y} = \tilde{p_x} + \delta\) : \(p = \pm \sqrt{\frac{L_2^2}{(3L_3)^2} - \frac{L_1}{3L_3}}\) \(= 1/3[\pi + cos^{-1}(q/p^3)]\) \(q = \frac{L_2^3}{(3L_3)^3} - \frac{L_1L_2}{6L_3^2} + \frac{L_0}{2L_3}\) \(L_3 = n_x + n_y \) \(L_2 = (n_x + 2 n_y)\delta - N - (s_x + s_y)\) \(L_1 = (n_y\delta - L_3 - 2s_y)\delta + s_x + s_y\) \(L_0 = s_y\delta(1-\delta)\) information equations see Miettinen (1985)

title: Miettinen-Nurminen Confidence Interval for Difference in Proportions — ci_prop_diff_mn
text: Miettinen, O. S., & Nurminen, M. (1985). Comparative analysis two rates. Statistics Medicine, 4(2), 213-226.

title: Miettinen-Nurminen Confidence Interval for Difference in Proportions — ci_prop_diff_mn
code: # Generate binary samples responses <- expand(c(9, 3), c(10, 10)) arm <- rep(c("treat", "control"), times = c(10, 10))  # Calculate 95% confidence interval for difference in proportions ci_prop_diff_mn(x = responses, by = arm) #> $estimate #> [1] -0.6 #>  #> $conf.low #> [1] -0.8406495 #>  #> $conf.high #> [1] -0.170025 #>  #> $conf.level #> [1] 0.95 #>  #> $delta #> NULL #>  #> $statistic #> NULL #>  #> $p.value #> NULL #>  #> $method #> Miettinen-Nurminen Confidence Interval #>   # Calculate 99% confidence interval ci_prop_diff_mn(x = responses, by = arm, conf.level = 0.99) #> $estimate #> [1] -0.6 #>  #> $conf.low #> [1] -0.8791616 #>  #> $conf.high #> [1] -0.02180912 #>  #> $conf.level #> [1] 0.99 #>  #> $delta #> NULL #>  #> $statistic #> NULL #>  #> $p.value #> NULL #>  #> $method #> Miettinen-Nurminen Confidence Interval #>   # Calculate the p-value under the null hypothesis delta = -0.1 ci_prop_diff_mn(x = responses, by = arm, delta = -0.1) #> $estimate #> [1] -0.6 #>  #> $conf.low #> [1] -0.8406495 #>  #> $conf.high #> [1] -0.170025 #>  #> $conf.level #> [1] 0.95 #>  #> $delta #> [1] -0.1 #>  #> $statistic #> [1] -2.24804 #>  #> $p.value #> [1] 0.01228681 #>  #> $method #> Miettinen-Nurminen Confidence Interval #>   # Calculate from a data.frame data <- data.frame(responses, arm) ci_prop_diff_mn(x = responses, by = arm, data = data) #> $estimate #> [1] -0.6 #>  #> $conf.low #> [1] -0.8406495 #>  #> $conf.high #> [1] -0.170025 #>  #> $conf.level #> [1] 0.95 #>  #> $delta #> NULL #>  #> $statistic #> NULL #>  #> $p.value #> NULL #>  #> $method #> Miettinen-Nurminen Confidence Interval #>

what: Stratified Miettinen-Nurminen Confidence Interval for Difference in Proportions — ci_prop_diff_mn_strata
title: Stratified Miettinen-Nurminen Confidence Interval for Difference in Proportions — ci_prop_diff_mn_strata
text: Calculates Stratified Miettinen-Nurminen (MN) confidence interval difference two proportions stratification.

title: Stratified Miettinen-Nurminen Confidence Interval for Difference in Proportions — ci_prop_diff_mn_strata
code: ci_prop_diff_mn_strata(   x,   by,   strata,   method = c("score", "summary score"),   conf.level = 0.95,   delta = NULL,   data = NULL )

title: Stratified Miettinen-Nurminen Confidence Interval for Difference in Proportions — ci_prop_diff_mn_strata
text: x binary vector representing responses. Can also column name data frame provided `data` argument. character factor vector exactly two unique levels identifying two groups compare. Can also column name data frame provided `data` argument. strata vector specifying stratum observation. needs length x multiple x multiple levels strata present. Can also column name (vector column names quoted) data frame provided `data` argument. method String specifying CI's calculated. must equal either 'score' 'summary score'. See details information implementation differences. conf.level numeric value 0 1 specifying confidence level. Default 0.95 (95% confidence). delta Optional numeric value(s) hypothesis testing. provided, function returns test statistic p-value `delta` hypothesis. data Optional data frame containing variables specified `x` ``.

title: Stratified Miettinen-Nurminen Confidence Interval for Difference in Proportions — ci_prop_diff_mn_strata
text: list containing following components:  estimate point estimate difference proportions (p_x -   p_y) conf.low Lower bound confidence interval conf.high Upper bound confidence interval conf.level confidence level used delta delta value used statistic Z-Statistic given `delta` null hypothesis p.value p-value given `delta` null hypothesis method Description method used ("Stratified   Miettinen-Nurminen Confidence Interval") `delta` provided statistic p.value NULL

title: Stratified Miettinen-Nurminen Confidence Interval for Difference in Proportions — ci_prop_diff_mn_strata
text: function implements stratified Miettinen-Nurminen method compute   confidence intervals difference two proportions across multiple strata. "score" method, approach: Calculates weights stratum \(w_i = \frac{n_{xi} \cdot n_{yi}}{n_{xi} + n_{yi}}\) Computes overall weighted difference \(\hat{\delta} = \frac{\sum w_i \hat{p}_{xi}}{\sum w_i} -           \frac{\sum w_i \hat{p}_{yi}}{\sum w_i}\) Uses stratified test statistic: $$Z_{\delta} = \frac{\hat{\delta} - \delta}           {\sqrt{\sum_{=1}^k \left(\frac{w_i}{\sum w_i}\right)^2 \cdot \sigma_{mn}^2(\delta)}}$$ Finds confidence limits test statistic equals critical values standard normal distribution \(\sigma_{mn}^2(\delta)\) Miettinen-Nurminen variance estimate.   See details ci_prop_diff_mn() \(\sigma_{mn}^2(\delta)\) calculated. "summary score" method, function: Calculates within-stratum confidence intervals using Miettinen-Nurminen method Computes weighted average midpoints intervals \(d_S = \sum (lower_i + width_i/2)\cdot w_i\) Weights inversely proportional squared standard errors: \(w_i = \frac{1/SE_i^2}{\sum 1/SE_i^2}\) Standard errors estimated \(SE_i = \frac{upper_i - lower_i}{2 \cdot z_{1-\alpha/2}}\) overall variance \(Var(d_S) = \frac{1}{\sum 1/SE_i^2}\) CI \(CI = d_S \pm z_{1-\alpha/2}\cdot \sqrt{Var(d_S)}\)

title: Stratified Miettinen-Nurminen Confidence Interval for Difference in Proportions — ci_prop_diff_mn_strata
text: Miettinen, O. S., & Nurminen, M. (1985). Comparative analysis two rates. Statistics Medicine, 4(2), 213-226. SAS Institute Inc. (2013). SAS/STAT® 13.1 User's Guide. FREQ Procedure. (summary score method)

title: Stratified Miettinen-Nurminen Confidence Interval for Difference in Proportions — ci_prop_diff_mn_strata
code: # Generate binary samples with strata responses <- expand(c(9, 3, 7, 2), c(10, 10, 10, 10)) arm <- rep(c("treat", "control"), 20) strata <- rep(c("stratum1", "stratum2"), times = c(20, 20))  # Calculate stratified confidence interval for difference in proportions ci_prop_diff_mn_strata(x = responses, by = arm, strata = strata) #> $estimate #> [1] -0.15 #>  #> $conf.low #> [1] -0.4337594 #>  #> $conf.high #> [1] 0.1605688 #>  #> $conf.level #> [1] 0.95 #>  #> $delta #> NULL #>  #> $statistic #> NULL #>  #> $p.value #> NULL #>  #> $method #> Stratified Miettinen-Nurminen Confidence Interval #>   # Using the summary score method ci_prop_diff_mn_strata(x = responses, by = arm, strata = strata,                       method = "summary score") #> $estimate #> [1] -0.1263657 #>  #> $conf.low #> [1] -0.4113263 #>  #> $conf.high #> [1] 0.158595 #>  #> $conf.level #> [1] 0.95 #>  #> $delta #> NULL #>  #> $statistic #> NULL #>  #> $p.value #> NULL #>  #> $method #> Stratified Miettinen-Nurminen Confidence Interval #>   # Calculate 99% confidence interval ci_prop_diff_mn_strata(x = responses, by = arm, strata = strata,                       conf.level = 0.99) #> $estimate #> [1] -0.15 #>  #> $conf.low #> [1] -0.5072331 #>  #> $conf.high #> [1] 0.2509363 #>  #> $conf.level #> [1] 0.99 #>  #> $delta #> NULL #>  #> $statistic #> NULL #>  #> $p.value #> NULL #>  #> $method #> Stratified Miettinen-Nurminen Confidence Interval #>   # Calculate p-value under null hypothesis delta = 0.2 ci_prop_diff_mn_strata(x = responses, by = arm, strata = strata,                       delta = 0.2) #> $estimate #> [1] -0.15 #>  #> $conf.low #> [1] -0.4337594 #>  #> $conf.high #> [1] 0.1605688 #>  #> $conf.level #> [1] 0.95 #>  #> $delta #> [1] 0.2 #>  #> $statistic #> [1] -2.223572 #>  #> $p.value #> [1] 0.01308862 #>  #> $method #> Stratified Miettinen-Nurminen Confidence Interval #>

what: Function to combine strata via interaction if strata is passed as a vector — combine_strata
title: Function to combine strata via interaction if strata is passed as a vector — combine_strata
text: Function combine strata via interaction strata passed vector

title: Function to combine strata via interaction if strata is passed as a vector — combine_strata

what: Expand Count Data into Binary Vectors — expand
title: Expand Count Data into Binary Vectors — expand
text: Converts count data (number successes total sample size) binary vector TRUE/FALSE values. useful converting summary statistics back raw data format analysis functions require individual-level data.

title: Expand Count Data into Binary Vectors — expand
Expand Count Data into Binary Vectors — expand
text: x Integer (vector integers) representing number successes. n Integer (vector integers) representing total number participants.

title: Expand Count Data into Binary Vectors — expand
text: logical vector TRUE represents success FALSE represents failure.   length vector equals sum sample sizes.

title: Expand Count Data into Binary Vectors — expand
text: pair values `x` `n`, function creates vector `x` TRUE values followed `n-x` FALSE values. multiple pairs provided, resulting vectors concatenated order.

title: Expand Count Data into Binary Vectors — expand
code: # Convert 4 successes out of 13 participants to binary data expand(4, 13) #>  [1]  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE #> [13] FALSE  # Convert multiple groups of data # Group 1: 9 successes out of 10 # Group 2: 3 successes out of 10 expand(c(9, 3), c(10, 10)) #>  [1]  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE FALSE  TRUE  TRUE #> [13]  TRUE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE

what: To get the n's and response totals with out without strata — get_counts
title: To get the n's and response totals with out without strata — get_counts
text: get n's response totals without strata

title: To get the n's and response totals with out without strata — get_counts
